com.license4j

Class HardwareID

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.license4j.HardwareID

  • public class HardwareID
extends java.lang.Object
    HardwareID class creates hardware id from hostname, ethernet address, disk volume serial number and hdd manufacturers serial number. AND or OR combination of hardware ids can be used in license validation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HardwareID() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String getHardwareIDFromEthernetAddress()
      Use ethernet MAC address for creating hardware id.
      static java.lang.String getHardwareIDFromHDDSerial()
      Use HDD manufacturer's serial number for creating hardware id.
      static java.lang.String getHardwareIDFromHostName()
      Use computer host name for generating hardware id.
      static java.lang.String getHardwareIDFromVolumeSerialNumber()
      Use OS system disk volume serial number for creating hardware id.
      static java.lang.String getVirtualizationSoftwareName()
      If software is running inside a virtual OS, returns virtualization software name.
      static boolean isVirtual()
      Detects if software is running inside a virtual OS.

        Use computer host name for generating hardware id.
        Returns:

      • getHardwareIDFromEthernetAddress

        public static java.lang.String getHardwareIDFromEthernetAddress()
        Use ethernet MAC address for creating hardware id.
        Returns:
        hardware id string or null if no network interfaces present

      • getHardwareIDFromVolumeSerialNumber

        public static java.lang.String getHardwareIDFromVolumeSerialNumber()
        Use OS system disk volume serial number for creating hardware id.
        Returns:
        hardware id string or null if volume serial number can not be read.

      • getHardwareIDFromHDDSerial

        public static java.lang.String getHardwareIDFromHDDSerial()
        Use HDD manufacturer's serial number for creating hardware id.
        Returns:
        hardware id string or null if serial number can not be read.

      • isVirtual

        public static boolean isVirtual()
        Detects if software is running inside a virtual OS.
        Returns:
        true if software is running inside a virtual OS.

      • getVirtualizationSoftwareName

        public static java.lang.String getVirtualizationSoftwareName()
        If software is running inside a virtual OS, returns virtualization software name.
        Returns:
        virtualization software name.
